citation.article-title: Paenibacillus residui sp. nov., isolated from urban waste compost
citation.source: International Journal of Systematic and Evolutionary Microbiology

p.s: Description of Paenibacillus residui sp. nov.
Paenibacillus residui (re.si′du.i. L. n. residuum leavings, scraps, residues; L. gen. n. residui of leavings, scraps, residues).
Cells may stain Gram-positive or Gram-negative and are motile rods (1.4–1.6 μm long and 0.5 μm wide).
Polar flagella may be observed and oval spores are positioned centrally in swollen sporangia.
Colonies are translucent and irregular on PCA after 48 h of incubation.
Catalase- and oxidase-positive.
Growth occurs at 25–50 °C, at pH 7–9 and in up to 2 % NaCl, with optimal growth at about 37 °C, pH 7 and 1 % NaCl.
Growth does not occur in an anaerobic atmosphere and nitrate is not reduced.
Citrate is not used, and H2S, indole and acetoin are not produced.
Urease activity is variable.
Glucose is not fermented.
Gelatin, starch, Tween 80 and casein are not hydrolysed.
Aesculin is hydrolysed.

Acid and alkaline phosphatase, esterase C4, esterase lipase C8, leucine and valine arylamidase, trypsin, α-chymotrypsin, naphthol-AS-BI-phosphohydrolase, β-galactosidase, α-glucosidase, β-glucosidase, N-acetyl-β-glucosaminidase and α-fucosidase are produced.
Arginine dihydrolase, lysine and ornithine decarboxylase, tryptophan deaminase, lipase C14, cystine arylamidase, α-galactosidase, β-glucuronidase and α-mannosidase are not produced.
The sole carbon sources assimilated are d-glucose, maltose, d-ribose, d-fructose, methyl α-d-glucopyranoside, amygdalin, arbutin, salicin, cellobiose, trehalose, gentiobiose, turanose and d-tagatose.

The following are not assimilated: l-arabinose, d-mannose, N-acetylglucosamine, potassium gluconate, caprate, adipate, malate, citrate, phenylacetate, glycerol, d-arabinose, l-arabinose, d-xylose, l-xylose, methyl β-d-xylopyranoside, d-galactose, l-sorbose, l-rhamnose, inositol, d-sorbitol, methyl α-d-mannopyranoside, lactose, melibiose, inulin, melezitose, raffinose, starch, glycogen, xylitol, d-lyxose, d-fucose, l-fucose, l-arabitol, potassium 2-ketogluconate and potassium 5-ketogluconate.
Acid is produced from glycerol, d-fructose, d-ribose, dulcitol, amygdalin, salicin, cellobiose, maltose, trehalose and gentiobiose.

Acid is not produced from erythritol, d-arabinose, l-arabinose, l-xylose, methyl β-d-xylopyranoside, d-galactose, d-mannose, l-sorbose, l-rhamnose, inositol, methyl α-d-mannopyranoside, N-acetylglucosamine, melibiose, sucrose, inulin, melezitose, raffinose, starch, glycogen, xylitol, d-lyxose, d-fucose, l-fucose, l-arabitol, potassium gluconate, potassium 2-ketogluconate or potassium 5-ketogluconate.

Variable for the assimilation of d-mannitol, erythritol, adonitol, dulcitol, sucrose and d-arabitol, and for acid production from d-xylose, adonitol, d-glucose, d-mannitol, d-sorbitol, methyl α-d-glucopyranoside, arbutin, lactose, turanose, d-tagatose and d-arabitol.
Resistant to cephalothin (30 μg), ceftazidime (30 μg), colistin sulfate (50 μg) and streptomycin (10 μg).

Susceptible to meropenem (10 μg), amoxicillin (25 μg), gentamicin (10 μg), ciprofloxacin (5 μg), SXT (sulfamethoxazole/trimethoprim, 23.75/1.25 μg), tetracycline (30 μg), ticarcillin (75 μg) and sulfamethoxazole (25 μg).
The predominant cellular fatty acids are anteiso-C15 : 0, iso-C15 : 0, iso-C16 : 0, anteiso-C17 : 0 and iso-C17 : 0 and the major respiratory quinone is MK-7.
The cell wall peptidoglycan is of the A1γ type (directly cross-linked meso-diaminopimelic acid).
The DNA G+C content of the type strain is 49 mol%.
The type strain is MC-246T (=DSM 22072T =CCUG 57263T), isolated from municipal urban waste compost.
